reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel in a super location. Staff were very friendly and booked a number of trips for us. We ate in the bar the first night and our food was excellent and so cheap!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Would definitely go back there again.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Again, like all places in SA, you really should bring a travel iron with you as the Claridge have to send your items out to be pressed and this can take 24 hours!
reviews.title: There are better choices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great hotel in a fabulous location.You could walk to most destinations and the rooms and facilities were very good for a hotel in the city.I cannot understand the negative reviews.Would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Comfy room

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights on the Claridge Hotel. We found the front desk staff to be arrogant and unhelpful (and we speak spanish, so language was not an issue). The location of the hotel is not desirable. It is near Florida street, which is a pedestrian shopping street. The street is full of people trying to get you into their stores, street performers and beggars. On a previous trip, we stayed in Recoleta, which is a much nicer neighborhood. The rate was good, but I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Rubbish Internet!

likes.liked: — The service, the luxury, the bar!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Claridge´s is located near the madness that is Florida St but you wouldnt know this inside. Our room was very small but had a really comfy bed. Free internet access was great and the bar is really nice. The only downfall was that my first experience of argentinian steak was in their restuarant and it really didnt live up to it´s reputation!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 8 days in Buenos Aires - all at the Hotel Claridge. The location was a little too downtowny for our tastes - very busy narrow streets, but the hotel was excellent. It was particularly nice to come back after a hot day of sightseeing (it was hot even in late March) and climb into a beautiful pool with all that goes with it.
reviews.title: Great downtown pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very nice and our room facing the pool and in the back of the hotel was totally quiet. The room was not especially large and the bathroom was tiny. Service was very prompt and friendly. The breakfast was extensive though it often seemed a bit hectic.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, great location

reviews.text: All in all, an excellent hotel that would be even better if it was located in Recoleta or Palermo.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay in the Claridge Hotel was excellent from the time we arrived until we left. We finished our trip in Argentina in the Claridge following a recommendation from a friend, and we were not disappointed. At the start of our stay we stayed in Palermo, which we also loved, but we found the location of the Claridge to be better. You feel more in the city and there is a lot going on. You are also very close to the port.
reviews.title: Ideal location - a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Claridge is old school and it looks & acts like it. It's kind of dowdy and could use a makeover, but I suspect they think it's "traditional" aspects make it attractive to the English, if not Americans. Very much a home-away-from-home place, if you're used to staying in places that your grandparents might have stayed at.
reviews.title: Great location and mild charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a prime location that provides an easy walk down to the revitalized Puerto Madero area and also the Florida shopping area (beware of pickpockets there!). Rooms were average, I thought. Had a problem on the first night where they stuck us with a double bed, although we had asked specifically for 2 singles - they couldn't fix the problem, which didn't make me happy.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area on the 2nd floor is a nice oasis in the city.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located near the pedestrian shopping street, Florida. It is in a very congested area with very heavy traffic. Having requested a quiet room, we were facing the back and overlooked the pool. We were on the 10th floor so noise was not a problem.
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was appointed beautifully. It was quite large and had beautiful drapes and bedspread. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive and the concierge very helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in Feb. 2008 at this hotel and were very disappointed. The bathroom was a ridiculous size for a 5 star hotel, and it was impossible to turn on the shower without either being attacked by cold water or very hot water. It took 5 phone calls and 2 hours to obtain an iron and another phone call to obtain an ironing board. After 5 requests and 2 days our room was cleaned and the mini bar refilled. We asked a very unfriendly and rude female concierge to make a reservation for us at a restaurant and we had to ask whether it had been successful as she had no intention of telling us.More seriously, the day before we arrived a group of people sitting in the bar had their hand luggage stolen, yet we saw lots of luggage unattended in the hall.
reviews.title: Smallest bathroom in the world.

likes.liked: — The bedroom and bed were very good and the position of the hotel excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no way this hotel deserves 5 stars.
reviews.title: Not for People In Wheelchairs
Great base for BA
reviews.text: On our way to and from a cruise to Antarctica, my husband (who uses a wheelchair) and I stayed at the Claridge, a very centrally located hotel in the heart of Buenos Aires. Unfortunately, the washrooms in the rooms are not accessible to people who use wheelchairs. The public rooms are accessible but this isn't much consolation. We managed but it was very difficult and for most wheelchair users, it would be impossible. We booked this hotel through Expedia and were more disappointed with it than with the hotel itself. Otherwise, the Claridge is quite pleasant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Claridge twice, once on our honeymoon in 2005 and once in late 2007. Both times we found it to be well appointed, with friendly staff. The hotel is in a great location for exploring Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: Great deal, pleasant stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time around we booked through Expedia and were pleasantly surprised to find that full breakfast was included, despite the Expedia booking stating otherwise.
reviews.title: great place to stay for a few days
